entities.name: snape
entities.description: Professor McGonagall and Harry mention Snape in the context of his past actions and relationship with Dumbledore.

entities.name: mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is mentioned as a character who trusts Dumbledore's judgment regarding Snape.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as the one who trusted Snape and believed in his repentance.

entities.name: voldemort
entities.description: Voldemort is mentioned as the one who was given information by Snape that led to the death of Harry's parents.

entities.name: tonks
entities.description: Tonks is mentioned as a character who expresses curiosity about what Snape told Dumbledore to convince him.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who knows what Snape told Dumbledore and shares this information with Tonks and McGonagall.

relationships.description: Dumbledore trusted Snape, believing in his repentance.
Snape passed information to Voldemort that led to the death of Harry's parents.
Snape apologized to Dumbledore for his past actions and expressed regret over the deaths of Harry's parents.
Harry knew what Snape told Dumbledore to convince him.
